@context.description: JSON-LD context for interpreting the configuration as RDF

escapeParameters.description: If true (default), input port values are URI-escaped (RFC 2396) before expanding variables in the URI template.

request.description: The HTTP request the REST activity is to perform

absoluteURITemplate.description: The URI template for this request.  The template is an URI with 0 or more {variables}, e.g. http://example.com/user/{username}?page={page} (RFC6570 Level 1). Matching activity input ports are created for each variable, so the variable name must be a valid Taverna input port name.

headers.description: HTTP headers of the request. GET requests SHOULD include Accept. PUT and POST request SHOULD include Content-Type. The header Expect: 100-continue is recognized and supported by the REST activity for POST and PUT requests.

header.description: The HTTP header name, e.g. Accept or Content-Type

value.description: The value of the HTTP header, e.g. text/plain

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method of the REST request

showActualURLPort.description: If true, the output port 'actualURL' is added to show the requested URL after expanding the template.

showRedirectionOutputPort.description: If set, the output port 'redirection' is added, showing the URL of the requested body. This is particularly useful for following redirection.

showResponseHeadersPort.description: If true, the output port 'responseHeaders' is added to show the response header from the HTTP server.

title: REST activity configuration
